newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech floods seen causing heavy damage to crops.
newsitem.headline: Czech floods seen causing heavy damage to crops.

text.p: Flooding in the eastern Czech Republic this week will result in large agricultural losses, officials said on Tuesday.
They said it was too early to estimate the full extent of damage.
Milos Kordac, an assistent to the president of the Czech Agrarian Chamber, said first early estimates should be known on Tuesday afternoon after a survey.
"There will be large losses... but it is too early for even early estimates," Kordac told Reuters.
He said Northern Moravia, the region worst hit by the flooding, was a grain, potato and sugar beet growing area.
Libuse Alterova of the Agricultural Ministry press department said more damage could follow as the flood wave was moving downstream on the Morava river to fertile area in southern Moravia.
"There certainly will be damages, and they probably will not be small," she said.
Weather forecasts were for more heavy rain at least until Tuesday night, with some easing during the night and on Wednesday.
In some parts of the north-eastern region 125 millimetres of rain fell over the past 24 hours.
Thousands of poeple have been forced to leave their homes, many houses were swept away by flood streams and 18 people are feared dead.
Rail and road transport and telephone links and power supplies to the worst affected areas were cut.
